instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Hey all, have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board on my desk right now that came in with liquid damage, was stuck at 5v. Replaced a liquid damaged <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and a few surrounding components and now board turns on and boots. When it gets to the OS the mouse is very laggy and the fans spike up to 100%. AHT reports no issues. Wondering where to start on this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message:
You should try known good trackpad.
Try first disconnecting LCD connector, using external monitor.
Or just disconnecting the webcam...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Tested with just the logic board itself outside of the case plugged into external mouse/kb/display with LCD connector removed. Same laggy mouse and very slow unfortunately.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message:
If INTERNAL trackpad is not connected, this behavior is normal.
It has thermal sensors, required by SMC!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Did not know that! I'll test again with a new trackpad and cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: This one is officially stumping me, have tried 2 known working trackpads/cables with all else disconnected and still get slowness/high fans

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Did you test with known good trackpad board/flex and webcam disconnected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Correct, the trackpad and flex I'm using to test work fine in another unit I have in. LCD flex is completely unplugged from LB, I'm testing with external video

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs slow, fans 100%
threads.message: Check the temperatures reported by HWMonitor.
